urls.title: Earth Trust chosen as environmental partner for Oxford Flood Scheme - Earth Trust
urls.description: We are pleased to be collaborating with the Environment Agency as environmental partner for the Oxford Flood Alleviation Scheme over the next 3 years, to advise and enhance the long‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
We're pleased that we have been chosen to be the environmental partner for the @OxfordFAS. Our role will be to help plan for the long term environmental, climate and human health and wellbeing benefits of the scheme.

Read our full news story: https://t.co/fhdu9nlvhE https://t.co/I1JayEajtB

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
A number of flood warnings and flood alerts have been issued by the @EnvAgencyNW for Cumbria.

‚û°Ô∏èGo to their website for more information: https://t.co/rs7TzHmrjp https://t.co/ItanqjyEn8

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE Great to join you virtually on site today @AdamBaylissEA
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE Nice work. I cycle past that every day.

Rain üåßÔ∏è is still expected throughout the day in #Cumbria. Stay safe, always keep your distance from swollen rivers and don‚Äôt drive through flood water. 

just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car üöó

#Prepareactsurvive https://t.co/ruBakdutZ9
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Thank you for keeping this on our Agenda...we need to push hard to protect our rivers

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:ü§ê
https://t.co/Tqd9MZUd24

urls.title: HebWeb News 2021 - New bursary to help students researching flood management
urls.description: A new annual bursary has been set up to support Master's students investigating natural flood management. The bursary is named in recognition of the work of the founder of Treesponsibility and The Source Partnership, Penny Eastwood, otherwise known as Dongria Kondh.

tweets.text:
Great article about the new student bursary @UniversityLeeds 
awarded to Sophie Tankard to study natural #flood management #NFM

Funded by @EnvAgencyYNE @slowtheflow_UK & @Calderdale in recognition of 
Dongria Kondh @treesponsibilit 

@hebdenbridgeweb 
https://t.co/nSoYF0lbAB https://t.co/ES8RnW6Dnh

@Richard_corrie Hi Richard. Thanks for flagging this up to us. Please could you report this to our 24 hour incident hotline 0800 80 70 60, confirming the location so our officers can look into this further.

The @EnvAgencyYNE  #SheafScreen in #Sheffield is coming along nicely.

Most of the major civils works are now complete and control panels installed, next steps are the debris grabs, electrical wiring, welfare provision and the final user testing. 

Due for completion mid 2021. https://t.co/w70e6NwrdI

@CranfordAction @Rachel_A_ @EnvAgency @thameswater @Thames21 @SE_Rivers_Trust Sounds like we might need to do the same. @Rachel_A_ - if only there was someone locally who had completed the @Thames21 #ActionForHealthyRivers course...

With yet another local authority signing up enhance and protect Staffordshire‚Äôs #NatureRecoveryNetwork we edge closer to full countywide adoption. @CraigBennett3 @StaffsWildlife @NE_WestMids @EnvAgencyMids @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/9cwjev7DYG
